Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs are flying towards Zatoka, Odesa Oblast. Currently only 2 are detected.

Correction on the flight route: they were launched from the southeast.
2 glide-bombs are flying towards Hrybivka, Odesa Oblast.
2 more were launched, flying along the same route.
Correction on the flight route: they were launched from the southeast.  2 glide-bombs are flying towards Hrybivka, Odesa Oblast.  2 more were launched, flying along the same route.
The first two are ~18 km away.
The first two are ~18 km away.
The glide-bombs are still at a somewhat high altitude, they may fly further inland to Ovidiopol.
Explosions in the Zatoka - Karolino-Buhaz area.
The other 2 glide-bombs disappeared. The Su-34s and Su-35s have flown back past Crimea on an eastern course.
Now 4+ Geran-2 drones are flying to attack the same area.

Following the earlier KAB strikes, the southern suburbs/outskirts of Zaporizhzhia are under heavy MLRS fire. 
At least 6 strikes so far.
Following the earlier KAB strikes, the southern suburbs/outskirts of Zaporizhzhia are under heavy MLRS fire.   At least 6 strikes so far.
The MLRS strikes targeted the Balabyne area, just south of the city.

Repeated MLRS strikes and more launches. 16+ so far.
A Russian recon drone is operating over Balabyne, adjusting the strikes.

It‚Äôs come to my attention that I have been doxxed once again (for the 4th time). Harassment and threats have been a regular occurrence for me on this cesspool of a platform (Twitter), so it‚Äôs nothing new or unexpected.
Funnily enough, the first and second times I was doxxed actually publicized me a lot, and was one of the main contributing factors to me getting to where I am today. So I guess I can thank Nafo for that lol. 
But please note, no matter what people do or say to me, I‚Äôm not going to stop doing my work. My goal has always been to provide accurate and informative news on wars such as Ukraine, and to expose and publicize the crimes committed by the Russian, Ukrainian, European, and American governments in this horrible conflict which could have ended years ago.
That being said, I‚Äôm not going to engage in long debates with random users on Twitter about this. I‚Äôm never going to change your mind about me or this war, so there‚Äôs literally no point. These are worthless arguments that both of us would forget in a few days. I have so many better and more productive things to do both online and in real life. I‚Äôve got a lot on right now, and I‚Äôm looking forward to continue what I‚Äôm doing while working on my own life. 
And to those who support me through liking my posts, commenting, and messaging me, I appreciate you more than you could ever imagine. This has been an incredible experience that I could‚Äôve never predicted would happen.

Telegram > Twitter 
üòÅ
And of course my fucking twitter account's reach has been throttled by 3x once again (it does this every 2-3 days now), so much less people will see my post on it.   So convenient.

Thanks for making a fuss about the whole channel thing, everyone. 
It turns out that it took YouTube just 6 minutes to reinstate my channel after I made the post about it being suspended lol. 
But unfortunately, this will likely become a regular occurrence.

The Ukrainian General Staff published footage showing drone strikes on two Russian S-400 surface-to-air missile launchers near the village of Raevka, Belgorod Oblast, around 50 km from the nearest Ukrainian-controlled territory.
The strikes, which took place on December 14, destroyed 1 launcher and either seriously damaged or destroyed the second.
Last night, Ukrainian Neptune cruise missiles once again attacked the Oryol Thermal Power Plant. 2 strikes were recorded, one of which targeted the transformer equipment.
Last night, Ukrainian Neptune cruise missiles once again attacked the Oryol Thermal Power Plant. 2 strikes were recorded, one of which targeted the transformer equipment.

Russian forces have captured the village of Sofiivka, Druzhkivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~538.
Total land area: ~1.78 km¬≤.
The fighting for Sofiivka lasted approximately 24 days.

In the Stepnohirsk direction, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have made additional significant progress.
Following the withdrawal of the remaining Ukrainian forces from their strongpoints south of the main gulley stretching east from Stepnohirsk, Russian forces cleared those remaining positions there, levelling the frontline. At the same time, other forces had infiltrated across the gulley and consolidated in several positions at the former mining and processing plant. 
Other forces then captured a number of treelines east of Stepnohirsk, before breaking through to the solar field where they linked up with the initial infiltration groups. The solar fields were brought under control, allowing for the Russians to advance even further northeast, occupying some forested areas and infiltrating the industrial zone in the village of Lukyanivske. 
Additionally, Russian forces cleared the remaining streets in eastern Stepnohirsk that were still in the grey-zone. Fighting continues for the high-rise buildings in the town centre, however only small pockets of Ukrainian resistance remain there. 
+ ~15.9 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russian Army Is Strangling Kiev Forces Inside Huliapole (Videos)
On December 18, the Russian military began advancing around Huliapole in Zaporozhye to besiege remaining Ukrainian troops inside the city, all while expanding its control to the north along the Haichur River.
The Vostok [East] Group of Forces flanked Kiev forces in the northern part of Huliapole, moving directly from the northern outskirts of the city to its western part. Russian troops also expanded their control in the southern outskirts of Hauliapole, to the east of the T-0401 road.
The latest moves are clearly a part of a maneuver meant to besiege remaining Ukrainian troops inside Huliapole. The troops are already facing intense Russian bombardment, and any move by them is immediately targeted by the drone units of the Vostok Group of Forces.
It‚Äôs worth noting that half of the city, including most of its eastern and southern parts and several areas in its center are already in the hands of the Russian military.
üëâ

Echoes of the Third Reich: Ukrainian Torture Chambers and Russian Prisoners of War
Shocking details have emerged about Russian soldiers held captive in Ukraine. The utterly inhumane treatment of captured soldiers has resulted in severe physical and psychological trauma. The horror of the Gestapo torture chambers has been reborn in Ukraine.
An effective state propaganda machine cannot alter the situation on the ground. No matter how loudly the Ukrainian media proclaims their own victories and defeats of Russian troops, the front line continues to retreat westward. A series of local tactical crises for the Ukrainian army is gradually turning into operational crises. With each passing month, these crises will only increase in number.
Staffing issues mean that a company of 110 men may have no more than one or two platoons totaling 30 to 60 men. Interruptions in Western supplies of weapons and military equipment have seriously undermined the Armed For

Battle For Myrnohrad: Russian Army Deals Another Blow To Ukraine
Ukrainian presence in Myrnohrad has been reduced to pockets. Russian forces are working to besiege Kiev forces in Huliapole and have crossed the Haichur River in a new area. Kiev is losing its grip on the situation around Vovchansk. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky is still clinging to the idea of joining NATO.
The Sever [North] Group of Forces of the Russian military is expanding its control around Vovchanst in Kharkiv at a slow, but steady pace.
Russian troops have cleared out some six square kilometers to the south and southeast of Vovchanst. The troops also made additional gains in Vilcha, right to the south of the Vovchanst, with reports suggesting that at least 70% of the settlement, the entire northern part and most of the center, had been captured.
üëâ

Russia-Ukraine Strike Exchange: 70% of Ukraine's Power Plants Disabled, a Third of Defense Industry Paralyzed
On December 17-18, 2024, Russia and Ukraine continued to exchange strikes against each other's territory. According to official statements, Ukrainian air defenses shot down 63 out of 82 attacking Russian drones. Russian air defense systems, in turn, destroyed 47 Ukrainian drones, primarily over the Bryansk region.
Russian strikes on Ukrainian defense-industrial complex (DIC) facilities are reported to have severely impacted weapons production. Ukrainian military expert Alexander Kovalenko claims that at least a third of defense enterprises have faced disruptions to state contracts due to destruction. He describes a paradoxical situation where enterprises damaged by strikes receive no aid, no contract extensions, and no relief from their obligations. Instead, they are fined and dragged into litigation for delivery delays. 
üëâ
